section.title: Overview
section.p: A threshold is a definition of a usage counter or bucket boundary or limit, and an associated set of actions to take upon crossing that boundary or limit.
A threshold profile group must contain atleast one threshold profile in it. A threshold profile must contain atleast one threshold in it.
The threshold information is defined in a single Threshold Profile Group table. Threshold is embedded within the threshold profile which in turn is embedded within the threshold profile group.

note.p: A bucket or counter can refer to zero or more threshold profile groups of the same unit type.

section.p: If there is an overcommit, the threshold may get executed twice. This happens when the extra overcommit amount is more than the gap to the next threshold value.
For the preceding example, the threshold profile group is defined as follows:

li.p: Threshold profile group 1: It contains Threshold profile 1, Threshold profile 2, and Threshold profile 3. The unit type is volume.
Threshold profile 1: It is an absolute type profile that contains the Threshold 1 with a value of 400 MB from bucket. The unit is in MB.
Threshold profile 2: It is an absolute type profile that contains Threshold 2 with a value of 1 GB from the bucket. The unit is in GB.
Threshold profile 3: It is a percentage type profile that contains two thresholds - Threshold 3 and Threshold 4.
Threshold 3: It is defined with a value of 80%.
Threshold 4: It is defined with a value of 100%.

section.p: The bucket of 5 GB refers to the Threshold profile group 1.
